physical_examinations.vital_signs: Blood glucose level: 440 mg/dl; Glycosylated hemoglobin: 13.3%
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patient presented with diabetes at the age of 3 months during an episode of acute gastroenteritis, with no detectable neurological problems. Normal psychomental development, no seizures, and a normal electroencephalogram.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After switching to glibenclamide, stable metabolic control was achieved, with glycosylated hemoglobin levels between 6.5 and 6.9% over the course of treatment, indicating improvement.
